welcome.data: Warm-up prompt: “What do you like about how your favorite website looks and works?” Students discuss and share.

aim.data: State agenda and objective: Understand UI vs. UX and create both paper and digital wireframes using Figma.

review.data: Review HTML structure from previous lesson. Discuss how structure affects content layout and user experience.

relevant.data: Teach the difference between UI and UX using examples. Introduce wireframes as blueprints for layout. Demonstrate Figma interface.

interactive.data: Students create a paper wireframe of a coffee shop homepage, then recreate it digitally in Figma.

ownership.data: Students submit both wireframes and a reflection on UI vs. UX to Canvas.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: Students reflect on what they learned and list one lingering question.

supplies.data: Computers with internet, Figma accounts, paper and pencils, projector, Canvas access.
